message: I was generally curious if anybody else has had difficulty getting NVM up and running using the Zsh. I wasted to much time hacking the script to be a little more generic yesterday, and decided to just manually compile some directory targeted version installs of node in the end
I didn't know about NVM until I saw this -- totally cool.  thinking about integrating it into our build system to do regression testing on new node versions.
For development purpose I can use nodemon also, (npm install nodemon).
I suppose it would be good to include a link to Node Version Manager (like RVM, Ruby Version ManageR) ...thanks for the idea @nickmeyer: https://github.com/creationix/nvm

@oivoodoo NVM is quite a bit different than nodemon... the earlier concerns maintaining several version of the node binary (v0.2.x, v0.4.x, etc.) and related npm bundles, for cross-version testing, and dependency lockin
